marketNews.title: China Economy Exceeds Expectations, Imports of ATH Coal
marketNews.content: China's National Bureau of Statistics recorded that China's economic growth in Q4 2024 reached +5.4% YoY (vs. Q3 2024: +4.6% YoY), exceeding consensus expectations at +5% YoY and marking the highest annual growth in the last 6 quarters. This result brought China's economic growth throughout 2024 to +5% YoY (vs. 2023: +5.2%), in line with the Chinese government's target and exceeding the World Bank's projection of +4.9% YoY. On a quarterly basis, China's economy in Q4 2024 grew +1.6% QoQ (vs. Q3 2024: +1.3% QoQ), aligning with consensus expectations. China's economic growth in Q4 2024 was driven by a series of stimulus measures from the country's government and central bank since September 2024 to support economic recovery. For 2025, the World Bank projects China's economic growth will slow to +4.5% YoY along with declining household and business confidence, headwinds in the property sector, and trade war risks. Although slower, this projection is still +0.4 percentage point higher compared to the World Bank's previous expectation. In December 2024, Reuters reported that the Chinese government plans to set an economic growth target of around +5% for 2025, with the budget deficit increasing from 3% to 4% of GDP. This Reuters report came a few days after leaders in China - including President Xi Jinping - concluded the annual economic conference in Beijing, where they are expected to have set targets that will be officially announced in the parliamentary session in March 2025. Bloomberg reported that both targets are largely in line with economists' expectations. Besides recording above-expectation economic growth, China also recorded its highest ever coal imports in 2024 amounting to 542.7 million tons (+14.4% YoY). This amount is equivalent to 41% of total global coal imports, according to data from the London Stock Exchange Group. China's realized coal imports in 2024 were also more than double that of India - the second-largest coal importer in the world - which imported 250.2 million tons of coal last year. Based on BPS data, the volume of Indonesian coal exports to China during 2024 reached ~93.2 million tons (+14.1% YoY), although in value terms it decreased by -6% YoY to ~$6.6 billion USD. For 2025, the China Coal Transportation and Distribution Association projects that China's coal imports will decrease by -3.26% YoY to 525 million tons as domestic production increases. The association estimates that China's coal production will grow by +1.5% YoY in 2025, while demand is projected to grow around +1% YoY. Key Takeaway: We assess that the outlook for China's coal demand will depend on the extent and effectiveness of the stimulus that the Chinese government will continue to disburse to boost growth in that country. The projection for China's coal demand and imports by the China Coal Transportation and Distribution Association itself does not mention the level of stimulus assumptions used. Increased coal demand is crucial to offset the predicted increase in coal production in 2025, both from China itself and Indonesia. On the other hand, we note that the decline in ICI coal prices - which are more relevant to Indonesian producer issuers - is much shallower compared to the recent decline in Newcastle coal prices [see table]. This has the potential to provide support for the performance of these producers. Furthermore, domestically, the potential revision of coal royalties is also a factor that investors need to monitor.

marketNews.title: US Census Bureau recorded that retail sales in the US grew +0.4% MoM in December 2024
marketNews.content: The US Census Bureau recorded that retail sales in the US grew +0.4% MoM in December 2024 (vs. Nov 2024: +0.8% MoM), lower than the consensus expectation of +0.6% MoM and marking the lowest growth in the last 4 months. Despite this, core retail sales - used to calculate US GDP - grew +0.7% MoM, marking the highest growth in the last 3 months. Annually, retail sales in the US grew +3.9% YoY in December 2024 (vs. Nov 2024: +4.1% YoY).

marketNews.title: Finance Ministry on Thursday (16/1) released Finance Ministerial Regulation No. 136/2024 to implement the global minimum corporate tax of 15% effective January 1, 2025
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Finance on Thursday (16/1) released Finance Ministerial Regulation No. 136/2024 to implement the global minimum corporate tax of 15% per January 1, 2025, as part of international efforts to limit tax competition between countries. This tax, initiated by the G20 and coordinated by the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), applies to multinational corporations with annual global turnover exceeding 750 million euros. The Head of the Fiscal Policy Agency of the Ministry of Finance, Febrio Kacaribu, stated that the government will provide tax incentives to ensure this minimum tax does not affect investment, although he did not provide further details regarding the incentives.

tickerNews.title: BUMI Exploring Bauxite & Alumina Business Opportunities
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported that Bumi Resources is exploring opportunities to acquire bauxite mines and plans to build an alumina smelter in the future. Kontan also reported that BUMI plans to establish an operational cooperation for bauxite mining by partnering with PT Laman Mining, a bauxite mining company in West Kalimantan. Responding to this news, BUMI Corporate Secretary, Dileep Srivastava, stated that they do not close opportunities to acquire metal and mineral mines, adding that BUMI "will continue to move forward in non-coal projects such as metals and minerals."

tickerNews.title: Alexandra Sinta Wahjudewanti increased ownership in RATU
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Raharja Energi Cepu, Alexandra Sinta Wahjudewanti, purchased 200,000 RATU shares at an average price of 2,500 rupiah per share on January 13, 2025. The total transaction value reached 500 million rupiah. Following this transaction, Alexandra's ownership in RATU increased from 0% to 0.0073%.

tickerNews.title: SSIA targets revenue growth of ~8% YoY in 2025 with land sales target of 137 hectares
tickerNews.content: VP Head of Investor Relations of Surya Semesta Internusa, Erlin Budiman, stated that they are targeting revenue growth of approximately +8% YoY in 2025, with a land sales target of 137 hectares. Erlin also mentioned that SSIA recorded land sales of 162 hectares during 2024 (+704% YoY), equivalent to 88% of the upgraded 2024 target of 184 hectares. Meanwhile, SSIA's construction business unit, Nusa Raya Cipta (NRCA), recorded new contract value of ~3.7 trillion rupiah in 2024 (+26% YoY). Erlin stated that NRCA is targeted to record a new contract value of 3.75 trillion rupiah in 2025.

tickerNews.title: Summarecon Agung recorded marketing sales of 853.8 billion rupiah in December 2024
tickerNews.content: Summarecon Agung recorded marketing sales of 853.8 billion rupiah in December 2024 (+153% MoM, +3.4% YoY). This result brought marketing sales throughout 2024 to ~4.37 trillion rupiah (-3.4% YoY), equivalent to 87% of the 2024 target of 5 trillion rupiah. The housing segment contributed 75% of 2024 marketing sales, followed by shophouses (15%), apartments (5%), land plots (4%), and offices and commercial (1%). During 2024, several segments realized below target, namely shophouses (97%), land plots (43%), and apartments (31%).

tickerNews.title: MMIX's joint venture to establish a baby diaper factory in Tangerang Regency
tickerNews.content: Multi Medika Internasional stated in a clarification to the IDX that its joint venture with Fujian Nicepaper Hygiene Products Co., PT Multi Nice Paper Indonesia, will establish a baby diaper factory with a capacity of 72,000 diapers per day in Tangerang Regency, Banten. This factory is expected to begin production in August 2025. Previously, MMIX announced the establishment of this joint venture on January 6, 2025, with a company ownership stake of 15%.

tickerNews.title: Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara sold ~2.2 million DRMA shares
tickerNews.content: Dharma Polimetal Commissioner, Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara, sold ~2.2 million DRMA shares at an average price of 913 rupiah per share on January 14, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~2 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Noel's ownership in DRMA decreased from 1.482% to 1.434%.

tickerNews.title: Adi Putera Widjaja sold ~17.6 million PGJO shares
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Tourindo Guide Indonesia, Adi Putera Widjaja, sold ~17.6 million PGJO shares at an average price of 92 rupiah per share on January 15, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~1.6 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Adi Putera Widjaja's ownership in PGJO decreased from 2.28% to 0.0001%.

tickerNews.title: PT Baramega Citra Mulia Persada sold ~68.3 million PGUN shares
tickerNews.content: A shareholder of Pradiksi Gunatama, PT Baramega Citra Mulia Persada, sold ~68.3 million PGUN shares at an average price of 318 rupiah per share on January 16, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~21.7 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, the ownership of PT Baramega Citra Mulia Persada in PGUN decreased from 16.88% to 15.69%.

tickerNews.title: Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs: Revised regulation on placement of natural resource export earnings funds (DHE SDA) will be released next week
tickerNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated on Thursday (16/1) that the regulation revising the placement of natural resource export earnings funds (DHE SDA) is currently in the finalization stage and is likely to be released next week. Previously, Airlangga confirmed last week that the government will revise the minimum tenor for DHE SDA placement from 3 months to 1 year in the revised regulation. Nevertheless, it is not yet known whether the portion of DHE SDA placement will change from the existing regulation of a minimum of 30%.

tickerNews.title: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources: Oil lifting target could reach 900,000 barrels per day in 2029
tickerNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated on Thursday (16/1) that the government targets oil lifting to reach 900,000 barrels per day by 2029. This target is much higher than the 2024 realization which only reached 571,700 barrels per day. The realization of oil lifting in 2024 itself was lower than the 2024 APBN target of 625,000 barrels per day.

tickerNews.title: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources confirms that Specific Gas Price Incentives (HGBT) for seven industry groups will continue
tickerNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated on Thursday (16/1) that the Certain Natural Gas Price Incentive (HGBT) of 6.5 dollars per MMBtu for 7 industry groups will almost certainly be continued, although he did not provide details on when the incentive would be re-enacted. The HGBT incentive expired on December 31, 2024, thus urging industry players to ask the government to continue it to maintain the competitiveness of domestic industries. Bahlil also mentioned that there is currently a proposal to increase the number of industry groups receiving HGBT, but the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources is still conducting a study. Previously, Bahlil Lahadalia stated last week that they were discussing the possibility of reducing the number of HGBT recipients, especially for companies assessed to have recorded good internal rates of return.

tickerNews.title: IIMS 2025 targets transaction value of Rp 6.7 trillion, equivalent to IIMS 2024 realization
tickerNews.content: The President Director of PT Dyandra Promosindo, Daswar Marpaung, stated on Thursday (16/1) that the Indonesia International Motor Show (IIMS) 2025 exhibition to be held at JIExpo Kemayoran, Jakarta, targets a total transaction value of 6.7 trillion rupiah. This target is equivalent to the realization of IIMS 2024. Despite the challenging current automotive industry conditions, Daswar is confident this target can be achieved, given the increased number of participating brands in the exhibition. According to a Kompas report, IIMS 2025 will be attended by 24 motorcycle brands and 33 car brands (vs. IIMS 2024: 28 motorcycle brands and 23 car brands). IIMS 2025 will run from February 13-23, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Pefindo projects average retail SBN coupon rate of 6.3-6.7% in 2025
tickerNews.content: The Head of Economic Research Division of PT Pemeringkat Efek Indonesia (Pefindo), Suhindarto, stated on Thursday (16/1) that they project the average coupon rate for government securities (SBN) retail during 2025 will range between 6.3-6.7%. This projection assumes the offered tenors will range from 2-6 years and that further monetary policy easing will still occur. The government plans to issue 8 series of retail SBNs during 2025.

tickerNews.title: Reuters reports that India's CPO imports in January 2025 will fall to their lowest level since March 2020
tickerNews.content: Reuters reported that India's CPO imports in January 2025 will drop to their lowest level since March 2020. An anonymous government official in India told Reuters that India only imported 110,000 tons of CPO in the first half of January 2025, a relatively small amount considering India usually imports more than 750,000 tons of CPO per month. Industry players told Reuters that India's CPO imports could fall to the range of 370,000 tons in January 2025. This decline in CPO imports is being pressed by negative margins recorded by refineries due to CPO prices being more premium compared to their substitute products.
